intro: Lupinus arvensi-plasketti, commonly known as the field lupine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit and clusters of purple or blue flowers. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and roadsides. Lupinus arvensi-plasketti is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
